alert.note: Alert for Cobb; Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 04 at 10:27AM EST until January 05 at 10:20AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Chattahoochee River at Atlanta affecting Cobb and Fulton Counties. For the Chattahoochee River Basin...including Atlanta...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chattahoochee River at Atlanta. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 14 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the woodlands along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on Paces Ferry Road. Portions of an athletic field at Lovett School...backyards of residential homes on Cochise Drive...Paces Ferry Drive...Paces Manor and Farmington Drive...and walking paths by a restaurant will be under one foot of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 13.9 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 14.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 14 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
